trans-unit.source: Provides a type-safe way to set the <xref:System.Web.HttpCachePolicy.VaryByHeaders*> property.

The <xref:System.Web.HttpCachePolicy.VaryByHeaders%2A> property identifies which request header parameters ASP.NET uses to uniquely identify a variation of the response when there are multiple cached responses for a resource.
This is useful when a response depends on a set of client inputs, such as headers or parameters.
The HttpCacheVaryByHeaders is not directly related to HTTP cache-control headers, but helps ensure that a client or proxy varies by the specified headers.

For more information about `VaryByHeaders`, see RFC 2616: Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP/1.1, available on the [World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Web site](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37125).
See section 14, "Header Field Definitions", for complete details.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.HttpCacheVaryByHeaders"></xref> class.

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the ASP.NET output cache varies the cached responses by the <xref uid="langword_csharp_Accept" name="Accept" href=""></xref> HTTP header, and appends it to the out-going <xref uid="langword_csharp_Vary" name="Vary" href=""></xref> HTTP header.

The `Vary` header indicates the request-header fields that the server varies the response by the `Accept` field and specifies that the server selects the response based on the media types acceptable to the client.
For more information on HTTP headers, see RFC 2616: Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP/1.1, available on the [World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Web site](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37125).
See section 14, "Header Field Definitions", for complete details.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> when the ASP.NET output cache varies by the <xref uid="langword_csharp_Accept" name="Accept" href=""></xref> header; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets an array of values which specify the HTTP headers to be used for varying the cache.
An array of values which contain the HTTP headers for varying the cache.

Gets or sets a custom header field that the ASP.NET output cache varies the cached responses by, and appends it to the out-going <xref uid="langword_csharp_Vary" name="Vary" href=""></xref> HTTP header.
The `Vary` header indicates the request-header fields that the server varies the response by.
For more information, see RFC 2616: Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP/1.1, available on the [World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Web site](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37125).
See section 14, "Header Field Definitions", for complete details.
The <xref:System.Web.HttpCacheVaryByHeaders.VaryByUnspecifiedParameters%2A> method is called internally if the specified `header` has the value * (an asterisk).
The name of the custom header.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true " name="true " href=""></xref>when the ASP.NET output cache varies by the specified custom field; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Sets an array of values which specify the HTTP headers to be used for varying the cache.
An array of values which contain the HTTP headers for varying the cache.

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the ASP.NET output cache varies the cached responses by the <xref uid="langword_csharp_User-Agent" name="User-Agent" href=""></xref> header, and appends it to the out-going <xref uid="langword_csharp_Vary" name="Vary" href=""></xref> HTTP header.
The `Vary` header indicates the request-header fields that the server uses to determine which of multiple cached responses is sent in response to a client request.
The `User-Agent` field specifies that the server selects the response based on the client's user-agent type.
For more information, see RFC 2616: Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP/1.1, available on the [World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Web site](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37125).
See section 14, "Header Field Definitions", for complete details.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> when the ASP.NET output cache varies by the <xref uid="langword_csharp_User-Agent" name="User-Agent" href=""></xref> header, and adds it to the <xref uid="langword_csharp_Vary" name="Vary" href=""></xref> HTTP header sent to the client; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the ASP.NET output cache varies the cached responses by the <xref uid="langword_csharp_Accept-Charset" name="Accept-Charset" href=""></xref> header, and appends it to the out-going <xref uid="langword_csharp_Vary" name="Vary" href=""></xref> HTTP header.
The `Vary` header indicates the request-header fields that the server uses to determine which of multiple cached responses is sent in response to a client request.
The `Accept-CharSet` field specifies that the server selects the response based on the client's character set.
For more information, see RFC 2616: Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP/1.1, available on the [World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Web site](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37125).
See section 14, "Header Field Definitions", for complete details.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> when the ASP.NET output cache varies by the <xref uid="langword_csharp_Accept-Charset" name="Accept-Charset" href=""></xref> header and adds it to the <xref uid="langword_csharp_Vary" name="Vary" href=""></xref> HTTP header sent to the client; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the ASP.NET output cache varies the cached responses by the <xref uid="langword_csharp_Accept-Language" name="Accept-Language" href=""></xref> header, and appends it to the out-going <xref uid="langword_csharp_Vary" name="Vary" href=""></xref> HTTP header.
The `Vary` header indicates the request-header fields that the server uses to determine which of multiple cached responses is sent in response to a client request.
The `Accept-Language` field specifies that the server selects the response based on languages acceptable to the client.
For more information, see RFC 2616: Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP/1.1, available on the [World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Web site](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37125).
See section 14, "Header Field Definitions", for complete details.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> when ASP.NET output cache varies by the <xref uid="langword_csharp_Accept-Language" name="Accept-Language" href=""></xref> header and adds it to the <xref uid="langword_csharp_Vary" name="Vary" href=""></xref> HTTP header sent to the client; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Causes ASP.NET to vary by all header values and sets the <xref uid="langword_csharp_Vary" name="Vary" href=""></xref> HTTP header to the value * (an asterisk).
All other <xref uid="langword_csharp_Vary" name="Vary" href=""></xref> header information to be dropped.
The `Vary` header indicates the request-header fields that the server uses to determine which of multiple cached responses is sent in response to a client request.
The * value specifies that the server selects the response based on parameters not specified in request headers (for example, the network address of the client).
For more information, see RFC 2616: Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP/1.1, available on the [World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Web site](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37125).
See section 14, "Header Field Definitions", for complete details.
